column2: Partner with global teams across Business Operations, Application, Compliance, IT and Legal to manage technology risks and regulatory compliance.     Deliver assigned internal, external and jurisdictional audits per a published audit plan.     Implement and support GRC technologies and tools within the Enterprise Technology Function.     Draft and publish policies, standards, guidelines and procedures related to security and IT compliance.     Improve compliance of IT processes and identify opportunities for technology compliance control automation.     Execute end to end compliance initiatives in accordance with the compliance roadmap.     Design high-quality test plans and direct technology control test activities.     Build and maintain controls that map to compliance requirements, provide implementation recommendations and monitor evidence.     Continuously improve the technology control framework in alignment with industry trends     Contribute to coordination with jurisdictional inspectors and audit partners.     Keep up to date with external technology and compliance regulations, data privacy and security best practices.     Define and publish quantitative and qualitative technology compliance metrics and metrics to assess the success of the security program.     Identify strengths and weaknesses in IT technology operations and projects as they relate to privacy, security, business resiliency and regulatory compliance.     Document, formulate and enforce areas of security improvement that balance risk with business operations and do not diminish efficiencies or innovation.     Work in tandem with GRC and business leadership to perform ongoing security program assessments and audits and create annual strategic technology and budgetary directives.     Analyse findings, and document, recommend and report program gaps to security leadership.         What technical skills, experience, and qualifications do you need         At least 5-8 years relevant experience in IT audit, risk management and/or cybersecurity as a practitioner     Bachelor s degree in computer science, information assurance, MIS or related field, or equivalent industry experience.     Strong business acumen and security technology skills for well-rounded proficiency, as well as proven ability to align with security practices and compliance responsibilities.      Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, and proven ability to translate security and risk to all levels of the business.     IT Developer expertise to configure and administer GRC tools may be a plus.     Knowledge of global technology laws and regulations, including but not limited to PCI, SOX, FFIEC, ISO, GDPR, AIFMD, PSD2, EBA, ESMA, MAS, CSSF, CIMA, CBI, DORA.     Understanding of audit standards and practices, and control frameworks (   ISO, NIST, COSO, COBIT, etc.).       Understanding of security concepts of threat categories (such as malware, phishing attacks, Defense-in Depth, MITRE ATTCK framework).     Understanding of    technology    policies, standards, and guidelines   .       Experience with regulations and regulatory expectations regarding technology in the region of your accountability.     Capacity to understand legacy and progressive technology and security controls along with respective risk. Working knowledge of technologies such as cloud computing, DevOps and application security.     Track record of acting with integrity, taking pride in work, seeking to excel, being curious and adaptable, and communicating effectively.             Additional Qualifications             Prior experience conducting internal and/or external audits.      Prior hands-on experience working with any GRC systems like Diligent, MetricStream, Logic gate, One trust, Archer etc.     Demonstrated problem-solving capabilities, and ability to manage complex local and international security requirements.     Self-motivated, directed, and well-organized, with the vision to position controls in anticipation of threats.      Highly trustworthy; be an Individual contributor and Team player who leads by example.           Certification Requirements           Holds or is working towards one or more security, audit or risk industry certifications preferred such as: CISSP, CISM, CRISC, CISA, CIA, CIPP, CIPT, CIPM, CERA, CRM, GRCP, GRCA or ISO 27001 LA.     Any Certifications in IT Programming like .net, Java, Python, SQL, APIs etc is a good to have.

column2: The IT - Auditor and Risk Analyst is a highly respected, influential, and in-demand role within the business.         ?The position is responsible for supporting the security direction of the business and elevating the company s security posture across multiple jurisdictions.          The IT Auditor Risk Analyst is expected to support the security strategy of the business within new and existing information system capabilities. Consequently, the position requires both an understanding of legacy systems, as well as new technologies and regulatory requirements.              The IT Auditor Risk Analyst is also responsible for leading internal audit efforts and coordinating with audit partners.          The ideal candidate is technical and possesses at least five-eight years relevant experience in security, compliance, risk management, or audit. In addition, the candidate should have a strong background in application development and configuration specifically around GRC tools.          The role oversees the business adherence to security requirements and obligations mandated by standards, regulations and regulating bodies such as the Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX), General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council (FFIEC), and International Organization for Standardization (ISO), AIFMD, PSD2, EBA, ESMA, MAS, CSSF, CIMA, CBI. In tandem with security leadership, the IT Auditor Risk Analyst consistently assesses, audits, and validates the assurance of the security program.          As a primary point of contact for internal and external auditors, the IT Auditor Risk Analyst monitors progress and enforces resolution of outstanding issues that may lead to non-compliance or security threats to the business.          As a key member of the information security team, the IT Auditor Risk Analyst must focus on strong risk management and corporate resiliency, and not be driven solely by compliance           Your role   :       Partner with global teams across Business Operations, Application, Compliance, IT and Legal to manage technology risks and regulatory compliance. column2: Your Job The Identity Analyst will be a part of a global team that handles Identity Access Management for Koch Industries employees. They will report to the Identity Supervisor at KGSI (Koch Global Solutions India). In this role, you will collaborate with technology peers and business partners to plan and design solutions surrounding Identity Access Management (IAM). The Identity Analyst will be expected to identify and suggest trends and technologies in identity management that may create value for Koch Industries. Our Team We are looking for a contribution motivated employee who is  eager to be innovative in their work, while supporting teammates in projects and tasks. This person must be highly organized and a self-starter who thrives in working in a team setting. What You Will Do Work on integrating various applications to SailPoint IdentityNow, ensuring robust identity and access management across the organization. Onboard new enterprise resources and applications per our IAM standards, strengthening their adoption and enhancing their usability. column2: You will have the unique opportunity to maintain and further develop the R&D organization s data systems to ensure that they function optimally and in accordance with users needs. You will report directly to the R&D Manager, Systems & Processes, and cooperate with colleagues from different functions all over the world (among others, R&D, Digital, Operations).             ?       Make an impact and drive improvements       You have a quality and business orientation approach to perform your assignments. You have excellent planning skills and are a phenomenal teammate who contributes to close collaboration at all levels of the organization. You understand the importance of the interaction across functions and have a customer service attitude to efficiently perform your tasks.                 ?       Key responsibilities           Support the automation/digitalization journey of the R&D organization by developing, updating and maintaining the existing product lifecycle management (PLM) system.         Plan, coordinate and implement IT projects to ensure that they are delivered on time and within budget, adhered to defined quality standards and meeting agreed user specifications and expectations.         Ensure proper and efficient digital integration between the PLM software and existing and new digital solutions within Hempel.         Ensure that applications are implemented and operated according to agreed standards within Hempel.         Provide technical support and training to end users.         Ensure adherence to the IT security policies.                   Key tasks            Work with user groups to identify and solve business challenges within the RD organization through digitalization/automation and mainly related to the existing PLM software at data and scripting level. Collaboration is not only with R&D user groups but also with other business functions (mainly Digital/IT, Supply Chain, Production, Product and Assortment Management, Technical Support).         Based on the above, improve existing and design new end-to-end solutions that improve collaboration, productivity/efficiency and knowledge sharing within the R&D organization but also with other business functions if applicable/relevant.         Ensure proper and efficient integration between the existing PLM software and other existing or new applications. This requires close collaboration with the Digital/IT function.         Prepare, coordinate, follow-up and ensure proper implementation of projects, within budget and following a realistic project plan in accordance with the priorities of the department and other involved parties /functions .         Understand client pain points and troubleshoot as challenges arise.         Handle users daily requests and incidents, ensuring proper prioritization among them and related to other projects.         Close collaboration with other team members to ensure open communication, knowledge sharing and proper workload distribution to achieve department objectives.         Provide training and support to users on new and existing digital tools/applications within R&D.                   Key Success Criteria s / KPIs           Completion of agreed IT projects. They must meet the specifications, be delivered on time and within budget.         Satisfactory resolution of users incidents and requests related to the PLM software and other applications used in R&D.         Satisfaction level of users.                   Work relations       Internal with all different areas in the company, as well as external (software suppliers).                 ?       Required education, experience and job-related skills           Knowledge and experience in SQL database is a MUST.          Knowledge and experience in .NET, preferably in VB.NET is a MUST.          Fluent in English - oral and writing is a MUST.          University degree in information technology is preferable.                   General behavioural competencies most relevant for the job         Planning & organizing.     Quality orientation.     Problem solving.     Business orientation.     Customer service orientation.     Flexible and adaptable attitude.     Ability to work as part of a team as well as individually

column2: The SAP ERP CS Analyst is a senior SAP Supporting role, The ERP Analyst is a functional specialist in the SAP core area of CS. In addition to SAP support responsibilities and others as assigned, the SAP ERP Analyst is also responsible for coordination, execution and delivery quality of CS modular acivities across multiple systems, regions and sites.      Coordinating with a team of internal functional specialists on both the Clients Run Support Team and the Clients Change Team as well as third parties, the SAP ERP Analyst is responsible for ensuring that the deliverables of the workstream are performed completely and with the right level of quality, as well as ensuring that the workstream integrates and coordinates with other workstreams in the delivery of Support activities. The SAP ERP Analyst will need to work with internal and/or external resources to manage issues and gaps in interface functionality, SAP CS configuration and user exits.      The Sr. CS Analyst will be responsible to learn the CS designs in all the Clients Automation Solutions SAP Systems and recommend/drive improvement and design standardization opportunities that result in a lower support complexity. This role will act as a contributor for CS related RUN/Support projects, automation and related change          Responsibilities:        Responsible for oversight and execution of SAP CS bug fix & minor enhancement implementation      Participate in weekly CS meetings with internal & external counterparts      Audit processes performed by third parties to ensure compliance to Clients standards      Oversee, Design and implement SAP CS configuration & customizing in Clients Automation Solutions SAP Systems      Represent CS in Stakeholder/Relationship meetings      Review all CS Functional Specifications created by third parties & change team      Receive Knowledge Transfer from the change team      Oversee and execute ticket resolution, change delivery and release delivery within the Clients Automation Solutions Run Support Team.      Provides functional/technical expertise in the SAP CS module. SAP Configuration proficiency in given system module. Able to solve complex SAP technical issues. Strong SAP integration knowledge with SD, PP, MM, FICO and VC modules      Translates business requirements into detailed technical/functional specifications.      Collaborates and communicates with ABAP, Basis, Security and other relevant teams to ensure proper planning, development and execution of all work      Collaborates and communicates with Business teams to optimize solution delivery and scheduling. Ensures that new business processes/business requirements are documented qualitatively and that they are validated with the expectations of the customer      Oversight and execution of workstream activities primarily for RUN Support and minor enhancements across multiple systems. Ensure that workstream activities are progressing according to plan, and ensure delays and issues are identified and mitigating actions taken      Oversee & execute system testing & regression testing as required      Serve as the escalation point for RUN CS issues for business users as well as internal & external CS counterparts      Carries out all activities following Clients processes, policies and procedures          QUALIFICATION:        Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience      A minimum of 10 years of relevant IT experience in SAP      Experience with coordinating with multiple internal staff and consultants concurrently. Experience working in a heavily matrixed organization      Strong analytical ability, process oriented and ability to manage complexity. Able to work independently against an established set of guidelines      Support experience in a global environment including coordination and alignment with multiple stakeholders      Proficient utilization of MS Office, particularly Excel and Powerpoint      Strong verbal and written communication skills in English      Exceptional interpersonal skills      Experienced in the technical support of EDI, IDOC processing, Taxware & Tradesphere is preferred      Comprehensive understanding of SAPs customizing toolset, including IMG (Implementation Management Guide)      Comprehensive understanding of SAP data model in CS      Thorough business understanding of sales & manufacturing processes in a plant environment      Comprehensive understanding of SAP architecture
column11: System testing, Automation, Senior Analyst, Regression testing, EDI, MS Office, ABAP, Technical support, FICO, Auditing

column2: Willis Towers Watson (WTW) Information Cyber Security (ICS) requires an experienced IAM Oversight Analyst to work within the Identity and Access Management function.     As an experienced information security professional, you will be responsible for leading an internationally dispersed team, support the Global Head of IAM in developing the Identity Control Framework, manage the Identity Risk Portfolio, provide oversight of access recertification and privileged access processes for the entire organization through utilization of a range of IAM Products including Microsoft Identity, SailPoint and CyberArk.       You will be reporting to the IAM Governance Manager. This role is a hybrid role where the normal working base location will be balance between home and office as needed.                 Role:         This role will support the IAM Governance responsibilities within WTW and includes activities such as;       Provide oversight and input to IAM processes undertaken within ICS or wider across WTW including access recertification, privileged access, JML, policies/standards and risk process ensuring alignment with the internal Information and Cyber Security framework.     Assist the IAM Governance Lead in developing the IAM Governance control framework by continually researching new technologies, processes and practices contributing to the long-term Identity strategy within WTW.     Manage key audit requests from both internal and external auditors to provide regulatory evidence to support SOX, SOC2, HIPPA etc.     Perform as a subject matter expert within IAM covering all aspects of the Identity Security        Support solution development through problem solving to ensure adherence to Security Controls, Policies and Standards with a focus on automation and control.         Derive themes from identified gaps and recommend appropriate remediation measures to mitigate risk associated with gaps.         Work closely with senior leadership to identify improvement opportunities to enhance existing controls.               Requirements:       Skills:       4-8 years of experience in Identity and Access Management     Knowledge and understanding of Information Security Frameworks and standards (FFIEC, NIST, ISO etc)     Knowledge and understanding of Regulatory Risk and Compliance policies and programs     Experience of Cloud technology and Identity solutions and practices     Ability to work as part of a team      Knowledge of IAM controls and how to implement them effectively such as; toxic combinations, segregation of duties, lead privileged and zero trust     Ability to deliver change through people     Excellent Communication skills, especially written English     Strong Stakeholder management     The ability to foster and grow relationships.       Knowledge of SOx/SOC2 requirements for Privileged Access Monitoring and Access Governance Controls.       Experience of working in a live operational environment with an understanding of the impact of policy adherence is desirable.     Continuous Learner           Behaviors:       Resourcefulness and organizational agility     Global team player with good interpersonal and influencing skills     Conflict Management Resolution (Options Analysis)     Customer Focus Integrity and Trust     Personal Learning development
column11: Automation, ISO, Conflict management, Access management, Information security, microsoft, Stakeholder management, Operations, Monitoring, Auditing

column2: Role Description: Deutsche Bank is seeking an individual to join the eDiscovery Services team.The team is responsible for the Banks data retrieval, retention, and transfer of electronically stored information to internal requestors and external third parties to meet legal, compliance and regulatory requirements.This role has a direct impact on the Banks ability to respond to legal, regulatory, and human resource investigations and in turn the banks reputation. The eDiscovery Data Retrieval Specialist conducts the data retrievals, retentions, transfers, and quality control per request specifications. The successful candidate is a highly professional and organized individual, and their attention to detail is critical as the data set provided to our requestors must be complete and accurate. Your Key Responsibilities: Identify, retrieve, preserve, deliver, and quality control electronically stored information in support of ongoing legal requests, regulatory matters, or internal investigations in a legally defensible and reproducible manner, which maintains data integrity with a full chain-of-custody Maintain impeccable record keeping with an emphasis on accuracy and compliance with established procedures and adhere to controls for handling of strictly confidential data We are a diverse, global team and require applications from candidates who can operate comfortably within a global team to pick up projects and support other regions where data privacy permits Adhere to Service Level Agreements. Ability to anticipate, analyze, and resolve risks and issues while managing clear and concise communications and organizational escalation Collaborate on internal projects and initiatives to deliver service improvement to the organization Your Skills and Experience: Bachelors degree that is IT-related or with a legal-focus (essential). eDiscovery subject matter expert and eDiscovery work experience with a company, law firm, professional service provider, including knowledge of eDiscovery Reference Model framework and standards, understanding of legal procedure, process, and regulation (essential) Experience in client relationship management. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to positively influence and motivate stakeholders and team members through robust dialogue, facilitation, and persuasiveness. Ability to engage across a range of backgrounds and levels of seniority with the ability to translate technical terms into language that non-technical persons can understand (essential) Detail oriented, analytical mindset, and strong organizational skills. Proven experience with identifying opportunities for automation or simplification of repetitive tasks (essential) In-depth understanding of eDiscovery as well as forensics technologies, techniques, and workflows. Sound knowledge of enterprise level infrastructure and technology, e.g., messaging applications, business applications, databases, servers, backup, storage, compliance archiving (essential) People management experience (preferred)
column10: Investment Banking / Venture Capital / Private Equity
column11: Technology Operations, client relationship management, People management, eDiscovery Data Retrieval Specialist, legal, eDiscovery Reference Model framework

column2: Developers are a mainstay of product teams and are expected to have prior experience using modern, agile software     development practices. They will take responsibility for the design and development of applications, writing and     maintaining efficient code. They will work closely with product managers and architects to determine technical effort     required for product features and be able to efficiently estimate and break work down into vertical slices. Developers     have a quality first mindset, ensuring they create efficient unit tests and work alongside testers to create rapid     feedback loops. Although design and coding practices are a focal point of the role, developers will be expected to     have T-shaped skills, being able to turn their hands to the practicalities of testing, support and deployment.      A Developer will always look for ways to improve the efficiency of engineering practices, through methods such as     pair programming, continual refactoring and feature toggling Senior Developers will not be afraid to explore new     ways of working for the team to increase quality, stability and cadence of delivery.     A Developer works within product teams to:     Design and develop high quality products using modern engineering practices      Introduce techniques to ensure that high quality code can be delivered quickly and efficiently through     automation and modern software engineering practices and tools, such as:     o Effective branching strategies     o Efficient, lean test automation frameworks     o Utilizing automated code scanning tools     o Providing quick effective quality feedback     Ensure support items are rapidly triaged and managed     Work with DevOps engineers and test engineers to embed practices in the team which enable consistent,predictable, fully tested deployments     Directly lead and mentor developers and test engineers on all of the above     Engage with stakeholders to understand user stories and determine requirements     Provide guidance on what is configuration vs customization with a focus on solutions that remain close to out     of box functionality as possible.     Customize and develop ServiceNow applications and support rollout of new applications and modules.     Configure Application UIs and Workflows     Demonstrate understanding of application modules including ITSM, HRSD, Self-service Portal, Virtual     Assistance, Integration s hub and ATF.     Create custom reports and dashboards with supporting metrics and KPIs that adhere to best practices and     have a high focus on impact to instance performance     Collaborate with other ServiceNow administrators and developers to develop effectively with a global focus     Be diligent in maintaining consistency in code alignment across instances and in clean code in update sets     Proactively identify system deficiencies in the ServiceNow instances and provide solutions to remediate     Ensure that configuration is consistent across development, testing, and production environments.             Education and Experience:       2+ years of experience working in a development role for a ServiceNow Platform.   1+ years of experience as a ServiceNow administrator.   Experience in transitioning technology from locally focused to centralized technology service organization.   Experience with ITSM, ITBM, HRSD, Integration Hub or Service Portal modules within ServiceNow   Understanding of RESTful Web Service and APIs.   IT and Security management best practice (ITIL, COBIT, ISO standards).   Experience developing workflows and supporting service technology teams   Experience in developing solutions in JavaScript and Glide   Education Level: Bachelor or equivalents.   Candidate Specifications:   Desired Certifications:   ITIL Foundations Certification   ServiceNow Developer Certification(s)   A Developer needs specific technical skills.   Strong understanding of ServiceNow - essentially holding the SNow ITSM Implementer Certification     o Best practices   o Core table structures   o Common SN APIs and Script Includes   o Scoped applications and SN store applications/plugins, including application upgrades     Good understanding of Javascript and related technologies     o NodeZ   o How inbound and outbound web services (specifically REST) work within ServiceNow   o Asynchronous APIs     Experience of      o Dialogflow or similar NLP / Experience of developing chatbots    o Using Git, Azure DevOps and VS Code     CV sifting criteria :   - 2+ year of experience in IT Development

Experience in Database performance tuning and troubleshooting users and application related issues  Exposure on database monitoring tools like SCOM, Rubrik, Redgate and others  Experience in continuous process improvement and automation using YAML and PowerShell   Experience in HA solutions like Always ON setup and maintenance, Log shipping, Database mirroring and replication  Experience in SQL Server cluster  Experience in Upgrade, Patching and migration to On Prem and Cloud  Experience in Azure Arc Managed Instance SQL Server  Experience on cloud like Azure will be preferred  Experience in Database security and encryption setup using TDE and masking  Manage database backup and recovery, as well as disaster recovery planning  Create, change, and improve SQL Server Agent tasks and maintenance plans.  Proactively monitor SQL Server maintenance tasks, troubleshoot failed processes, and address issues as soon as possible." Network Security	 1. Lead the design, implementation, and management of Cisco Umbrella network security solutions and related products, including Cisco NSE (Network Security Everywhere), Cisco ISE (Identity Services Engine), VPN solutions, WAN links, LAN management, load balancers (such as F5), and other security vendors' products. 2. Architect and deploy comprehensive network security infrastructures, integrating Cisco Umbrella and related technologies to protect against cyber threats, malware, and unauthorized access. 3. Configure and optimize security policies, rules, and configurations across diverse network environments, ensuring compliance with organizational security standards and regulatory requirements. 4. Monitor and analyze network traffic, security events, and incidents using a combination of Cisco Umbrella dashboards, SIEM systems, and other security tools to detect and respond to security threats. 5. Implement and manage VPN solutions for secure remote access, utilizing technologies such as IPsec, SSL VPN, and AnyConnect to provide secure connectivity for remote users and branch offices." Storage Admin- NetApp	"1. Design, implement, and maintain storage solutions based on business requirements and industry best practices, utilizing NetApp ONTAP and other NetApp tools, as well as Pure Storage solutions including Pure Array and FlashBlade. 2. Serve as the primary point of contact for all storage-related issues, troubleshooting and resolving complex storage problems efficiently, including provisioning and decommissioning of storage resources. 3. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of storage solutions with other IT infrastructure components, including network troubleshooting for NAS. 4. Conduct regular performance monitoring and tuning to optimize storage performance and capacity utilization. 5. Develop and maintain documentation, including standard operating procedures and technical diagrams, for storage configurations and procedures, including backup processes. 6. Provide guidance and mentorship to junior team members, sharing knowledge and best practices in storage management and network troubleshooting. 7. Stay updated on emerging storage technologies and trends, evaluating their potential impact on our infrastructure and making recommendations for adoption as needed. 8. Participate in the planning and execution of storage-related projects, including migrations, upgrades, and expansions, ensuring compliance with security and regulatory requirements related to data storage and management." Windows Admin(Nutanix/HCI)	 1. Design, deploy, and manage Windows-based infrastructure on Nutanix hyper-converged infrastructure (HCI) platforms to support business-critical applications and services. 2. Serve as the primary technical resource for all Windows-related initiatives, projects, and escalations on Nutanix environments. 3. Architect and implement Windows Server operating systems, including installation, configuration, and optimization, to ensure performance, reliability, and security. 4. Configure and maintain virtualized Windows workloads, virtual machines (VMs), and containers on Nutanix AHV (Acropolis Hypervisor) or other hypervisors such as VMware ESXi or Microsoft Hyper-V. 5. Manage storage and compute resources on Nutanix clusters, including storage provisioning, data deduplication, compression, and replication, to maximize resource utilization and efficiency. 6. Implement and maintain disaster recovery (DR) and high availability (HA) solutions for Windows workloads on Nutanix, including data replication, failover, and failback processes. 7. Monitor and troubleshoot Windows and Nutanix infrastructure performance, capacity, and health, using monitoring tools and diagnostic utilities to identify and resolve issues proactively. 8. column2: JOB SUMMARY   This is a customer facing role and usually first point of contact responsible for handling technical queries over phone, email, chat and ticket system. Technical Support Executive (TSE) should be having good communication and convincing skills. TSE is responsible for efficient provisioning, operation, installation/configuration and proper maintenance of systems software, applications, network and other related IT infrastructure.? TSE requires to apply fix as per the knowledge base, execute runbooks.?    DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES   Provide front line technical support for customers on hosted and managed services and escalate critical issues to Tier II support  Establish and maintain contact with customers for request and incident management.  Handling Outlook and Mailbox related issues  Assist users in connecting Video conferencing applications such as Zoom, WebEx, etc.  Walk customers through installing applications and computer peripherals  Monitor the availability events like storage availability, network and server performance, events, firewall and security logs.?  Monitor the backups, recovery errors, respond to the request regarding the restoration of the data, database, files  Monitor the metric alerts, performance related issues like high CPU utilization, Application performance, high Memory utilization, Application tuning and Query tuning  Installing Operating software, application software, productivity suites or any proprietary software  Creating users, security groups, computer accounts, and GPO policies in AD  Creating users, security groups in Azure AD  Creating email accounts in O365  Troubleshoot O365 related issues  Acknowledge the request for start / stop services, user creation and grant specific data access to user?  Perform initial level troubleshooting as per the Standard Operating Procedure for Knowledge base  Analyse, troubleshoot and resolve issues related to OS, software, office / business application, equipment, hardware, peripherals, etc.?  Configuration of Print devices (network and local), scanner on desktops  Maintain an inventory of IT hardware and software assets  SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE   1+ years of experience in supporting / maintaining Windows and Linux server environments  Must be proficient and experienced in deploying, configuring, and maintaining Windows 10, 8 & 7 and non-Windows devices and technologies?  Extensive experience working with different operating systems including Windows and Mac OS  Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications, Office365 applications, anti-virus, mobile devices and other IT systems  Basic knowledge on Switch, Router and Firewall functionalities  Should able to analyse / troubleshoot network printer, deskside printer issues?  Should have experience in monitoring the IT Infrastructure for capacity breach  Should able to configure backup job and fix the failed jobs  Should able to analyse the logs and provide logical solution  Ability to work effectively with customers over the phone / remote desktop.  Familiarity help desk software (e.g. ServiceNow, Freshdesk, JIRA, Track IT)  GENERIC ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITES   Answer technical queries (both initial and follow up) via phone, the ticketing system, email, IM Chat  Log all issues / customer requests and resolutions  Communicate with users, explain issues and resolutions, update activity or train on new equipment or software  Build an internal wiki with technical documentation, manuals and IT policies  Provides on-call high priority 24/7 technical support as necessary  Troubleshoot issues by utilizing resources like KB / Standard Operating Procedure, peer support, supervisor guidance and management consultancy  Ensure CMDB and all IT digital assets are real-time updated  Provided out-side hours support for critical, urgent and mission critical activities  Contribute in building technical knowledgebase  Provide methodological assistance to client / peers  Follow timely delegation / escalation procedure  Follow ITIL standard practices for incident, change and problem management  Outstanding analytical and technical problem-solving skills  Keep yourself updated with technology updates  Adhere to compliance and governance standards and report any non-compliances to the manager  Participate & contribute in IT team meetings  Foster professional relationship with all colleagues by listening, understanding and responding to their needs  Excellent Interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written)  Excellent organizational, time-management and prioritization skills  Promote positive customer service attitude among peers

Responsibilities         Learn proprietary software applications (Epiq Discovery, DMX), 3rd party eDiscovery applications (Relativity, NUIX), electronic discovery and data recovery processes.     Stage and process client data in different file formats.     Perform quality control for data extraction, text, native files and images.     Work closely with team members to troubleshoot data issues, research software and/or techniques to solve problems, and carry out complex data filtering tasks.     Provide feedback to management about potential software improvements and assist with user acceptance testing prior to new software releases.     Use technical expertise and thorough understanding of electronic discovery tools and technology to deliver expert level processing and data extraction to clients.     Complete work requests daily using Epiq s internal workflow ticketing system.     Communicate and collaborate with other company departments.             Requirements for the role include         Must possess a strong desire to learn new skills.     Must display excellent verbal and written communication.     Needs to consistently demonstrate strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills.     Must have a strong knowledge of database design and structure.     Must have the ability to demonstrate superior organizational skills and attention to detail while working effectively under pressure and meeting strict deadlines.     Must work well in a team environment.     Ability to communicate with teammates from different geographical locations     Curiosity and a constant interest in learning.     Excellent judgment, discretion, and diplomacy.     High standard of emotional maturity and personal presentation.                 Education & Experience         Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Business Management or closely related field of study or equivalent combination of education and experience.      Knowledge of the legal, software-as-a-service and/or professional services industries is a plus.     Light scripting skills preferred     SQL or other technical database proficiencies preferred             Leadership Competencies           Integrity    -- Behaves in an honest, fair and ethical manner; shows consistency in words and actions; does what she/he commits to doing; respects the confidentiality of information or concerns shared by others; is honest and forthright with people; carries his/her fair share of the workload; takes responsibility for own mistakes.       Client Focus    -- Takes action with the clients, both internal and external and sees their needs as a primary focus; builds a sustaining collaborative and productive relationship with clients; seeks to understand client situations, issues, expectations, etc.; takes appropriate action to meet client needs and address concerns; implements or utilizes methods to monitor and evaluate client feedback.       Results Driven    - Sets stretch goals for personal and team accomplishment and works tenaciously to achieve those goals; acts with a sense of urgency; takes the initiative on actions; identifies what needs to be done and takes action before being asked; does more than what is normally required in a situation; establishes metrics to monitor progress and measure success; maintains focus by avoiding or overcoming roadblocks.       Entrepreneurial Orientation    - Proposes innovative business opportunities/ideas to customers and business partners; encourages and supports entrepreneurial behavior in others; demonstrates willingness to take calculated risks to achieve business goals.       Decisiveness    - The ability to make well informed, effective, and timely decisions even when data is limited or solutions produce unpleasant consequences; perceives the impact and implications of decisions; ability to make tough decisions.

column2: Information Technology- Intern (FTC)        (      Job Number:          APA0142U    )          Work Locations      :          Hilton - Regional Office - India            16th Floor,  Two Horizon Centre,         Sector 43 Golf Course Road,  DLF Phase V            Gurugram        122002                      As Information Technology Intern- FTC,  you will be responsible for the day-to-day support of IT systems.             What will I be doing?              As an Information technology Intern,  you will support the IT Department in its efforts to ensure the quality and delivery of IT systems for both the hotel and its Guests.  These efforts will be fulfilled timely,  within budget,  and in accordance with IT operating standards.  Specifically,  the IT Intern will perform the following tasks to the highest standards:          Collaborating with Director field Technology Services India,  and with Field Technology Team Members- APAC        Assisting with Data collection,  Analysis and MIS preparation.         Assisting in project rollout management,  change management,  training and awareness programs.         Organise and maintain IT Resources.         Record all issues that arise and advice the IT Manager of any issues that need further attention.         Recommend system improvements to the IT Manager.                           What are we looking for?          An Information technology Intern serving Hilton brands will always be working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members.  To successfully fill this role,  you should maintain the attitude,  behaviours,  skills,  and values that follow:      Minimum education: Graduate    Minimum years of experience: 0-1    Minimum years of management experience: 0-1    Any Licences or Certificates Required: Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365 Products.     Additional Requirements (i. e. ,  % of Travel Time,  etc): None    Strong verbal and written communication.     Excellent analytical and Problem-Solving skills.     Ability to work well in teams.     Strong work Ethics and Attention to Detail.     Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills.     Current technical skills and knowledge of technology.             What will it be like to work for Hilton?          Hilton is the leading global hospitality company,  spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels.  For nearly a century,  Hilton has offered business and leisure travellers the finest in accommodations,  service,  amenities and value.  Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its  global brands .   Our vision  to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality  unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day.   And our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!      As a Hilton Team Member you can expect to receive:        Comprehensive training and support for your new role.     Team member only discount,  Global Hilton room rates- The best in the industry!    Discounts of upto 25-50% on products and services in participating Hilton outlets.     Access to Hilton University Training,  offering more than 3000 Learning Programs.     Career Development Planning Opportunities. You will be aligned with our Customer Support vertical and help us in managing/ resolving customers query, handling escalations and complaints of the dissatisfied customers & giving best resolutions. You will also be responsible for closing the fault and complaints within SLA's.strategic alignment of people and resources to business objectives in ways that optimize and automate scheduling and performance management based on agent availability, forecast call volume, and revenue targets.The Workforce Management team focuses on maximizing performance levels and competency for an organization. This includes activities needed to maintain a productive workforce, such as field service management, human resource management, performance and training management, data collection, recruiting, budgeting, forecasting, scheduling, and analytics. The team helps identify, evaluate and drive continuous improvement in Service Delivery Performance. This team is also responsible for innovation in the workforce management space - providing insights to Accenture and Client leadership on improving efficiencies. They also ensure adherence to revenue and cost targets, own efficiency improvement goals. This team also partners wit regional leads and ensure we are compliant on all internal and client audits. What are we looking for? Microsoft Excel Microsoft PowerPoint Workforce Management (WFM) Ability to perform under pressure Agility for quick learning Problem-solving skills Written and verbal communication Workforce Administration  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Any Graduation

column2: Summary     PwC s Operate delivers operational and managed services solutions to clients across a range of situations often associated with their regulatory, risk and/or compliance agendas. We bring together regulatory insight, highly skilled operational resources and an unrivalled tech offering to provide a high quality and cost-effective solution to operational delivery challenges. Our capabilities stretch across a number of business pillars including Financial Crime Operations, Compliance Operations, Change Management and Customer Management.             The role will be based in Kolkata, however as a result of the wide variety of clients and projects, you may be asked to work in other locations and beyond, sometimes at short notice and sometimes over lengthy periods of time. Your desire and ability to do this will be discussed as part of the recruitment process. Candidates who are unable or do not wish to work on projects in other locations will still be considered.           Role Description           Our data analysts are integral to our recent growth and success within our data management engineering division. You will be working on high profile client projects by supporting our engagement teams with a variety of data analysis tasks and will help drive PwC s continued success with the objective of discovering and leveraging useful information that can be used to support evidence based decision making. Our data analyst is expected to make recommendations about the methods and ways in which our engagement teams use and analyse data to improve quality and the usefulness of data systems. Key activities will include, but not be limited to:                 Defining data requirements to support business issues / queries             Defining the process for how data will be captured and managed             Collecting and interpreting data             Analysing results             Identifying patterns and trends in datasets             Visualising the data to convey complex data sets into meaningful management information             Defining new data collection and analysis processes             The Data Analyst will be required to support engagement teams with a number of tasks, which are supported through various data collection, interrogation and visualisation activities.          As an Associate you will be able to resolve standard problems         and common situations; you are competent at day-to-day application of the skill, and are able to present concepts, information and solutions. Will need to refer to an expert for non-standard issues and problems. Demonstrates good solid knowledge of the subject.             Our ideal candidate is one that has             A solid technical background with demonstrable data analysis skills gained in a practical environment.             Had demonstrable success within a range of complex project environments and sectors.             A proven ability to integrate well into a team and build relationships with key stakeholders.             Ability to work as part of a larger team and take responsibility for the work you deliver.             Strong verbal and written communication skills.             Is adaptable and open minded to deal with changing business needs.             Is open to pursuing professional qualifications, certifications and training.             Is technically minded to create innovative solutions to complex problems.             Proven analytical and skeptical mindset with an ability to develop solutions to technical problems             Is curious to challenge the status quo and push the boundaries of technology.             Can work across a wide range of tasks at one time and work to deadlines.             Key activities include, but not be limited to             Resolving issues regarding data quality, cleansing, integration and migration             Working as part of a data specialist team to deliver quality service to engagement client             Communicating with key stakeholders to define data requirements to support business issues / queries, including collecting, analysing, interpreting, and translating the result to non-technical stakeholders             Essential Requirements             1 - 2 years experience working as a data analyst in a corporate function             Knowledge and/or certifications demonstrating capability working with data models and reporting packages (ideally Power BI)             Ability to analyse large datasets             Ability to design and develop comprehensive reports             Strong verbal and written communication skills             An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving             Demonstrable experience of success within a range of complex project environments and sectors             Proven ability to integrate well into a team and build relationships with senior stakeholders             Proven analytical and skeptical mindset with an ability to develop solutions to technical problems             Experience using Azure and / or other cloud platforms              Additional skills / experience that will be beneficial              Previous experience working with clients in the UK or US                 Undergraduate degree (e.g. BSc, BA)             Experience working with Agile methodologies.             Experience in Azure DevOps             Experience working with the Microsoft Azure cloud-based ecosystem.

IBM Sterling Integration:    Design, develop, and maintain integrations using IBM Sterling Integrator to enable the exchange of data between applications and systems.       2. Mapping Expertise:    Create and configure data mapping transformations to ensure data accuracy and consistency during integration processes.       3. Configuration Management:    Manage and maintain configurations, settings, and parameters within the IBM Sterling environment.       4. Monitoring and Troubleshooting:    Monitor integration processes, proactively identify and resolve issues, and ensure smooth data flow.       5. Collaboration:    Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, analysts, and business stakeholders, to understand integration requirements and deliver effective solutions.       6. Documentation:    Create and maintain detailed documentation of integration processes, mappings, and configurations.       7. Performance Optimization:    Optimize integration processes for efficiency, speed, and resource utilization.       8. Security Compliance:    Ensure that all integration processes and data transfers adhere to security and compliance standards.       9. Upgrades and Maintenance:    Stay updated with the latest IBM Sterling releases and perform system upgrades and maintenance as needed.       10. Training and Support:    Provide training and support to end-users and team members on IBM Sterling-related processes and tools.       11. Problem Solving   : Troubleshoot integration-related issues and provide innovative solutions to address them.       12. Continuous Improvement:    Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement best practices to enhance the integration capabilities of the organization.       Required Skills IBM, IBM Sterlling, Sterling Integrator

column2: Position:  Virtualization Engineer.  Full time position.  Experience: 4-15 Years.  Location: Hyderabad.   Please find the job description below.  6+ yrs. experience supporting enterprise class infrastructure.  VMware ESXi upgrades/deployment/support.  VMware VCenter upgrades/deployment/support (VCSA as well).  VMware VUM.  Cisco UCS, HP and DELL Hardware.  FC, iSCSI, or NFS storage.  ESXCLI.  Familiarity with Veeam/SRM and other tools that plugin to hypervisor layer.  Distributed Switching (Cisco 1kv or VMWare DVS).  Understanding of basic Layer2 and Layer 3 networking concepts and topology relevant to hypervisor layer. Job Description: Virtualization Engineers play an important and significant role in the day-to-day operations and delivery of IT infrastructure for Secure-24's enterprise cloud environment. A Virtualization Engineer at Secure-24 is expected to implement to desired standards and support the following elements of an Enterprise caliber IT stack: Compute Hardware including converged and hyper-converged platforms, Hypervisors, and NFS, iSCSI, FC Storage.  In addition, Virtualization Engineers are responsible for third party tools for DR and backup that tie into that infrastructure such as Veeam and SRM. They are expected to know from a high level how all components of an enterprise IT stack work together and affect each other, and have specialized knowledge and troubleshooting ability in at least 1 or more layers of the technology stack.  Most importantly, Virtualization Engineers must be self-starting, display the aptitude and ambition to learn new technologies, and display a very high level of ownership of projects and environments they are involved in.  Daily Roles and Responsibilities:  Be able to effectively manage and work a ticketing support queue.  Troubleshoot and assess performance issues using typical hypervisor management tools providing relevant graphs and communications to customers.  Effectively respond to critical customer outages related to hardware faults and software bugs within the infrastructure.  Maintain new and/or existing environments including planning upgrades, tracking EOL dates and documenting inter-dependencies.  Manage projects self-sufficiently and to 100% completion. Upgrading       ESX Clusters. Upgrading/Refreshing       Hardware in ESX Clusters. Imaging       new ESX Clusters. Provisioning       new storage for hypervisors. Deploying       backup infrastructure. Deploying/Configuring       DR Elements (array-based replication, SRM). Executing       datacenter migrations and DR tests.  Effectively time track and report hours worked.  Proactively address issues in the environment and provide resolution.  Work with various vendors on problem tickets and drive vendors to resolution and root cause.  Provide root cause analysis and log evaluation after outages.  Create and manage necessary documentation including but not limited to system standards, run-books, etc. Think creatively to provide solutions in the environment.  Evaluating infrastructure readiness for new customer projects.  Participate in a weekend on call rotation. Additional Experience/Skillsets:  Scripting and Automation with PowerShell and Python  Oracle OVM, Hyper-V, or other non-Vmware hypervisor stacks  Oracle OEM  PURE Storage, Netapp Storage   VMware Horizon  Datacenter Racking/Stacking/Cabling  Strong analytical capabilities Internal Use: Relevant Certifications. Optional but relevant certifications are listed below.  VMware VCP 55 plus.  VMware VCAP.
column11: VMware, Storage, VSphere, ESXI, Backup

Advises internal or client business and technology groups on how to best address business issues, processes, and opportunities through technology. Identifies and gathers business and system requirements, develops test strategies, and plans, creates project and process specifications, coordinates with assigned project teams, and ensures that final requirements have been met upon project conclusion.           In this role, you'll make an impact in the following ways:             Analyses and defines business requirements and functional or operational specifications for small to moderate sized projects of limited complexity. Formulates and defines system scope and objectives.          Interfaces with all areas of IT on behalf of the business to resolve IT matters and improve business processes.         Coordinates business technology activities with internal partners.         Collects and defines business or functional requirements and translates them into functional design, test planning, and user documentation processes. Formulates project scope, objectives, constraints and assumptions based upon user needs as well as knowledge of the application.         Participates in development of the functional design and user documentation by analyzing business process flows or client requests and identifying changes. Uses knowledge of business needs to provide design support to software and application development teams.         Gathers information and provides analysis of business issues or client feedback for a specific function or application.         Tracks data and general technology requirements from businesses or functional areas for project of greater scope or complexity. Provides data and information to team members, as needed.         Supports testing of new or enhanced applications and/or systems. Tasks include case development, requirement traceability analysis, test preparation, script writing, and functional test execution. Identifies areas for improvement and works with technology teams to improve applications for business use.         Works with users and peers on planning, implementing, and supporting new or existing applications. Uses knowledge of business needs to provide design support to software and application development teams.         Participates in process improvement reviews and summarizes business issues and client feedback for teams review.         Trains users on new or enhanced applications and/or systems that are more straightforward in nature.         Uses general knowledge of regulatory and legal requirements and BNY Mellon corporate policies involving risk and control to support the development of improved business processes through technology.         No direct reports: provides guidance to less experienced Business Technology Liaison Support staff, as needed.          Responsible for the quality and completion of own work.              To be successful in this role, we're seeking the following:             Bachelors degree with 3 - 5 years of total work experience preferred.          Experience in information technology support preferred.          Prior experience and working knowledge of Reconciliations processes will be preferred.          Strong Interpersonal skills to be able to communicate effectively.         Strong PC skills, including knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite         Flexible with shift timing and weekend working as may be required to support the business requirements.

column2: We are seeking a motivated and customer-focused female Service Desk - L1 professional to join our team. The Service Desk - L1 will be the first point of contact for IT support issues and will provide basic troubleshooting and assistance to end-users. Responsibilities: Serve as the initial point of contact for IT support requests via phone, email, or ticketing system. Provide first-level technical support and troubleshooting assistance for hardware, software, and network issues. Respond to and resolve service requests and incidents in a timely and professional manner, adhering to established SLAs. Document and track all support requests and resolutions in the ticketing system, ensuring accurate and complete records. Escalate complex or unresolved issues to higher-level support teams or specialists for further investigation and resolution. Follow standard operating procedures (SOPs) and troubleshooting guides to resolve common IT issues independently. Assist with basic user account management tasks, such as password resets and account unlocks. Provide guidance and support to end-users on IT-related policies, procedures, and best practices. Collaborate with other IT teams and departments to escalate and coordinate resolution of IT incidents and service requests. Requirements: High school diploma or equivalent. years of experience in a customer service or technical support role. Basic knowledge of IT concepts and terminology. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with a friendly and professional demeanor. Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment. Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and processes. Fluency in written and spoken English (additional languages may be a plus).

column2: A Service Desk Analyst is a customer service professional responsible for providing technical support and assistance to end-users.          The job responsibilities of a Service Desk Analyst may include:         Answering phone calls, emails, and chats from end-users, and logging technical issues and service requests in a helpdesk system.     Providing technical support and troubleshooting assistance to end-users, resolving issues or escalating to higher-level support personnel as needed.     Performing remote diagnostic tests and providing guidance on how to fix common technical problems.     Documenting troubleshooting steps, incident details, and resolutions in a helpdesk ticketing system.     Installing, configuring, and maintaining hardware and software applications for end-users.     Identifying and communicating trends in support requests to help improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the helpdesk function.

column2: The Service Desk Analyst provides excellent customer service one on one, follows written instructions to resolve basic problems, is respected and works well with teammates, takes direction well, executes assigned project tasks on time, administrates user accounts, and executes basic scripts within their role. Answering and appropriately handling customer support requests via phone, e-mail, voice mail, and IM.                  Updating and keeping our inventory accurate.                  Assisting staff that is highly mobile and could be working out of many locations such as the office, the airport, their home, or various client sites.                  Documenting, tracking, and monitoring all work item and resolution activity in the tracking system to ensure a timely resolution. column2: The impact you will have in this role : Reporting to the Cyber Blue Team Regional Manager and working with technical leads and other associates, you are responsible for detecting, investigating, and responding to cyber security events in the organization as well as handling technical projects.  You are a member of the Cyber Security Incident Response Team (CSIRT) and as a result may be tasked with responding to cyber incidents outside of normal work hours. Your Responsibilities Monitor, Detect, Analyze, and respond to cyber security events. Perform eDiscovery and other technical tasks. Independently lead investigations and technical tasks. Train and mentor junior staff members. Participate in training, exercises, and process improvement program. Occasionally travel to conferences, training, and other DTCC offices (up to 10%). Participate in on-call rotation and occasional after-hours work. Qualifications: Minimum of 2 years in IT working experience. Bachelor's degree and/or equivalent experience preferred. Talents Needed for Success: Have at least two (2) years previous experience as a SOC analyst or similar role. Demonstrate the ability to produce written reports including detailed analysis and recommendations. Demonstrate the ability to convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences. Have hands-on experience with modern security tools and DFIR best practices. Demonstrate the ability to take high-level requirements and with some guidance produce and execute an action plan to accomplish tasks. Demonstrate the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks with some guidance. Demonstrate a strong desire to achieve and contribute to a high-performing team. Pay and Benefits: Competitive compensation, including base pay and annual incentive Comprehensive health and life insurance and well-being benefits, based on location Pension / Retirement benefits Paid Time Off and  Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. DTCC offers a flexible/hybrid model of 3 days onsite and 2 days remote (onsite Tuesdays, Wednesdays and a third day unique to each team or employee).

column2: At NCR Atleos, our Internal Audit Department (IAD) purpose is to help enable competent and informed decisions to add value and improve operations, while contributing meaningfully to Board and organizational confidence     We are indispensable business partners, with a brand focused on insight, impact and excellence     We believe that everything we do is to enhance value, provide insights, and instill confidence     To do this, we must be relevant, connected, flexible, and courageous     NCR Atleos IAD is seeking an IT Audit Associate to support our India Internal Audit (IA) team     As an IT Audit Associate, you will play a crucial role in enhancing our companys internal control environment and risk management processes     You will be responsible for executing IT audits across all technology layers, assessing IT risks, and providing recommendations to the management     This role demands a keen eye for detail, excellent communication skills and an ability to identify any control gaps and recommend improvements                   Key Responsibilities:             Audit Planning and Execution:    Assist in planning and executing IT audits to evaluate the effectiveness of IT controls. Work on audits related to IT infrastructure, applications, and data management systems and assess compliance with internal policies, external regulations, and requirements such as SOX. Recognize and adapt to changing circumstances. Identify IT risks and recommend mitigating controls.       Communication:    Communicate timely any significant changes to budget or scope and any significant audit findings, risks, and recommendations to the Internal Audit Senior and/or Manager.       Collaboration:    Work closely with IT, InfoSec (IS) and other business units to understand IT infrastructure, applications, and operations.       Reporting:    Document audit findings, highlighting issues, risks, and actionable recommendations. Present findings to the Internal Audit senior and/or manager.       Follow-up and Monitoring:    Assist with follow-ups on audit recommendations to ensure timely implementation of management s actions.       Continuous Improvement:    Stay abreast of emerging technologies, audit methodologies, and regulatory changes. Contribute to innovation and improvements to the IT audit process, controls and the overall Internal Audit Department.           Qualifications:             Bachelor s or Master s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Accounting, or a related field         1-2 years of experience in IT auditing, IT security or related field         Understanding of IT audit methodologies, IT governance frameworks, standards and/or regulatory frameworks (e.g., COBIT, NIST, ITIL, SOX, ISO, GDPR)         Experience with AuditBoard and analytic tools e.g., Power BI and Tableau a plus         Professional certifications such as Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) or Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) is a plus         Strong analytical and problem-solving skills         Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate technical information         Ability to travel and a team player with a commitment to personal and professional growth         Commitment to ethical conduct, integrity, and the promotion of a culture of accountability and continuous improvement         Strong organization and management skills in a multi-tasking environment         Positive individual who enjoys working in a fun and dynamic team environment

LeadVenture provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, LeadVenture complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. column2: Job Summary: We are seeking an experienced  Apigee Administrator  to join our team. As an Apigee Administrator, you will be responsible for managing and optimizing our API gateway infrastructure using Apigee, while also leveraging Amazon Web Services (AWS) for cloud deployment. Your role will involve ensuring seamless API management, security, and scalability within an AWS environment. Responsibilities Apigee      Administration: API Gateway       Management :       Configure, maintain, and troubleshoot Apigee API gateways. Proxy Configuration : Create and manage API proxies,       policies, and security configurations in Apigee. Traffic Routing : Implement routing rules, load       balancing, and caching for APIs. Monitoring       and Analytics : Monitor       API performance, traffic, and usage pattern AWS Cloud Integration: Infrastructure       Deployment : Set up       and manage AWS resources (e.g., EC2 instances, VPCs, security groups). API Deployment : Deploy Apigee components within       AWS, ensuring high availability and scalability. Integration with Other AWS Services : Integrate Apigee with AWS Lambda,       S3, RDS, and other services. Security       and Compliance : Implement       security best practices within the AWS environment. Performance Optimization: Scalability : Optimize Apigee and AWS resources for scalability during peak loads. Latency Reduction : Analyze and fine-tune API  response times. Resource   Utilization : Ensure       efficient utilization of AWS resources Disaster Recovery and Backup : Backup       Strategies : Design       and maintain backup and disaster recovery strategies for Apigee and AWS       components. High Availability : Ensure high availability and fault tolerance. Collaboration      and Documentation : Cross-Functional       Collaboration : Work       closely with development, operations, and security teams. Documentation : Maintain clear documentation for       Apigee and AWS configurations. Qualifications: Experience : 6-9 years of hands-on experience      in Apigee administration and AWS cloud implementation. Apigee Knowledge : Proficiency in Apigee API gateway administration,      including proxy setup, policies, and analytics. AWS Skills :      Familiarity with AWS services (EC2, VPC, Lambda, S3, etc.) and cloud      architecture. Networking :      Understanding of networking concepts within AWS. Security : Awareness      of API security practices and AWS security controls. Collaboration      Skills : Effective      communication and teamwork. Preferred Certifications: Apigee Certified API Engineer

column2: The IT End User Support will be responsible for providing expert technical knowledge in the maintenance of endpoint devices and applications. The goal is to solve and troubleshoot technical issues in the end user support area and manage the resolution process.            The IT End User Support will be responsible for providing expert technical knowledge in the maintenance of endpoint devices and applications. The goal is to solve and troubleshoot technical issues in the end user support area and manage the resolution process.             Main Responsibilities & Tasks:           End User support Level 1 and 2 for the resolution of incidents encountered in the use of Sartorius Group IT hardware and software         Remote support for employees         Install and deploy standard Sartorius Group software         Replace failed End Point devices         Fulfill access management change requests         Replace and deploy fixed and mobile PCs, and other IT equipment         Purchase of End Point devices and their accessories         Manage the technical documentation of non-standard local HelpDesk procedures (configuration of clients, troubleshooting, and software deployment)         Document non-standard users oriented procedures         Logistics management of IT equipment         Inventory management of End Point devices including accessories, spare parts, etc.               Qualification & Skills:           Graduate in Information Technology or a comparable qualification         3 years of working experience in IT End User Support         Good competency level covering a wide range of IT skills and disciplines that are needed for 1st and 2nd level support         Windows operating system experience with knowledge of the Windows registry, file and folder security, local/domain user security, and operating system troubleshooting         Familiarity and understanding of Active Directory         Proven ability to work effectively in a matrix team setting as well as independently with minimal error and guidance         Strong skills in Microsoft Office Suite (Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint)         ITIL Foundation certification is preferred         Familiarity and experience in using an ITSM tool         Effective written and verbal communication skills         Fluent in English

column2: ?                   We are seeking a proactive individual for a varied technical and business facing role who can help continually improve and enhance our Salesforce platform, gather requirements, design scalable best practice solutions, and effectively meet the demanding needs of the Salesforce project.     Salesforce configuration changes, including (but not limited to): Flow, milestones, assignment rules, approval processes, custom objects, lightning record pages, fields, page layouts, record types, dynamic layouts, apps, actions, custom settings, custom metadata, mobile administration.     Oversee all aspects of user and license management including new user setup/deactivation, roles, profiles, permissions, public groups, OWD, sharing rules.     ?     Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights to stakeholders and drive data-driven decision-making.     Perform regular system maintenance tasks, such as user management, data cleanup, and security audits, to ensure the reliability and security of the Salesforce platform.     Stay informed about the latest Salesforce features and updates, and proactively identify opportunities for process improvements and system optimizations.     Understanding of basic triggers/Apex code knowledge     Data management to improve Salesforce data quality, implementing rules and automation as needed.     Proactive system maintenance including Security Reviews, Release Updates, Health Check, and Optimizer     Daily user support Issues for a community of 150 users including ongoing user training     Drive progress and solve complex issues through Salesforce standard methodologies     Skilled in sandbox environment management and at following industry Standard CI/CD benchmarks and help lead all aspects of Release Management for all Salesforce Orgs     Implement and manage integrations between Salesforce and other business systems, ensuring data integrity and seamless communication.     Management of integrated applications including but not limited to Okta, Zuora, Gainsight, Mulesoft.               Candidate Profile:               Bachelors degree or higher in Computer Science or equivalent     Salesforce Certifications (Administrator or Advanced Administrator)     Expertise in Salesforce best practices across the platform, including third party applications.     5+ years of experience in Salesforce Administration     5+ years of experience in computer software admin/development in a company environment     Excellent interpersonal skills, as well as excellent communication skills, verbal and written.     Excellent ability to work in cross-functional teams.     Plans and carries out responsibilities with minimal direction.     Must be able to work in a fast pace with high level of accuracy.     Experience in implementation and configuration of Sales, Service, and Experience Cloud, Salesforce Community Sites, Salesforce CPQ      Regularly evaluate new Salesforce features and third-party solutions and explain benefits and risks.                Preferred Qualifications:               Electronic Signature Management (Examples: DocuSign, EchoSign)     Middleware (Mulesoft)     Marketing Automation Platforms (Examples: Marketing Cloud, Pardot, Marketo, HubSpot)     Contract Lifecycle Management Tools (Agiloft, Conga)     Customer Success Platforms (Gainsight)     Sales enablement tools and platforms     Document Creation tools (Examples: Conga Composer, Drawloop, Webmerge)     Microsoft Office 365 (Emphasis on Microsoft Excel)     Tableau or Power BI Reporting
column11: Computer science, metadata, Excel, Data management, System maintenance, Data quality, Middleware, Release management, User management, Salesforce
